title: As Judicial Plans Rock Israel, Secret Talks Seek Compromise
description: Benjamin Netanyahu’s plans to restrict judicial independence have divided Israel. But a small group of academics has met privately with lawmakers in a search for middle ground.

title: France’s Fight Over Retirement Is a Question of Identity
description: Resistance to the government’s plan to push back the retirement age is not just about working longer. It springs from a deep sense of what defines France as a nation.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Xi Accuses the U.S. of ‘Suppression’
description: Also, the U.S. central bank may raise interest rates higher than expected.

title: Biden to Host South Korean President for State Visit in April
description: The fact that President Yoon Suk Yeol received the second invitation of the Biden presidency speaks to the degree of cooperation expected from him on issues involving North Korea and China.

title: Senator Whitehouse Puts Climate Change on Budget Committee’s Agenda
description: For more than a decade, Senator Sheldon Whitehouse gave daily warnings about the mounting threat of climate change. Now he has a powerful new perch.

title: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant Conditions Have Deteriorated, Ukraine Says
description: The International Atomic Energy Agency last week warned that the situation at the plant, which Moscow seized soon after its invasion in February, was “precarious.”

title: Duong Tuong, Who Opened Western Works to Vietnamese Readers, Dies at 90
description: He translated works by Proust, Nabokov, Tolstoy and Emily Brontë into Vietnamese, and a classic Vietnamese poem, ‘The Tale of Kieu,’ into English.

title: 6 Palestinians Killed After Israeli Raid in West Bank Clashes
description: The Israeli military said one of those killed was suspected in the fatal shooting of two Israeli brothers in the West Bank village of Huwara, which set off revenge attacks by Jewish settlers.

title: U.S. Defense Secretary Affirms Support for Iraq on Baghdad Visit
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III met senior Iraqi officials less than two weeks before the 20th anniversary of the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq.

title: Intelligence Suggests Pro-Ukrainian Group Sabotaged Pipelines, U.S. Officials Say
description: New intelligence reporting amounts to the first significant known lead about who was responsible for the attack on the Nord Stream pipelines that carried natural gas from Russia to Europe.

title: Spying by Mexico’s Armed Forces Brings Fears of a ‘Military State’
description: This is the first time a paper trail has emerged to prove definitively that the Mexican military spied on citizens who were trying to expose its misdeeds.

title: The Second Year of Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine in Photos
description: Photographers in and around Ukraine have chronicled the devastation and misery wrought by the war.

title: FBI Searches for 4 Americans Kidnapped in Mexico
description: Gunmen fired on the Americans after they crossed into Matamoros, Mexico, from Texas on a trip to seek medical help in the country.

title: Ex-Minister Matt Hancock’s Leaked Texts Lift the Veil on U.K. Covid Policy
description: A trove of more than 100,000 WhatsApp messages exchanged between Matt Hancock, then the British health secretary, and other government figures revealed the scramble to coordinate the virus response.

title: U.K. Unveils Hard-Line Migration Plan, Taking Aim at Small-Boat Crossings
description: The proposal from the Conservative government particularly targets those arriving by irregular means across the English Channel, most of whom are asylum seekers fleeing war and persecution.

title: Zelensky Vows to Hold Bakhmut Days After Forces Hinted at Retreat
description: The Ukrainian military’s leadership supports continuing the seven-month battle for Bakhmut, President Volodymyr Zelensky says. Here is what we’re covering:

title: Video Shows the Apparent Execution of a Ukrainian Soldier
description: Ukrainian officials said they had opened a war crimes investigation.

title: A Real-life Spy Story
description: How the downfall of one intelligence agent revealed the astonishing reach of Chinese espionage.

title: Unions Vow to Bring France to a ‘Standstill’ Over Macron’s Pension Plan
description: Travel, schools and services were expected to be disrupted by nationwide strikes for a sixth time as the battle for public support intensified.

title: A Russian Editor Evades Putin’s Censorship
description: Galina Timchenko, founder of the dissident news site Meduza, has adapted as the information noose has tightened since the invasion of Ukraine.

title: An Architect Applies Her Skills to Giving Back
description: Diana Kellogg specialized in high-end New York residences. Now, she has designed a girls school in India and is pursuing other projects that address social change.

title: Moldova’s Pro-Europe Leader Tries to Thwart Russia’s Influence
description: Maia Sandu, president of the former Soviet republic, remains popular in a deeply divided nation as Vladimir V. Putin continues to apply pressure.

title: Forging Connections Among Members of the African Diaspora
description: Almaz Negash lives in California, but never forgot her native Eritrea. Now she heads a group that brings together dispersed Africans, philanthropists, entrepreneurs and business leaders.

title: A Pakistani Aid Worker Responds to Her Country’s Dire Needs
description: Dealing with refugees and record flooding, Shabnam Baloch is leading efforts in Pakistan for the International Rescue Committee.

title: Fire in Bangladesh Camp Adds to Rohingya Refugees’ Misery
description: Twelve thousand residents of the camp, already some of the most dispossessed people on earth, were left without shelter.

title: Zelensky says Ukrainian troops won’t withdraw from Bakhmut.
Could the Next Blockbuster Drug Be Lab-Rat Free?
description: Alternatives to animal testing are gaining momentum.

title: China’s Leader, With Rare Bluntness, Blames Troubles on U.S. Containment
description: Xi Jinping criticized what he called a U.S.-led campaign of “encirclement and suppression.” His new foreign minister said it was impossible for China not to fight back.

title: New Japanese Rocket Is Destroyed During First Test Flight to Space
description: The H3 is intended to serve as the country’s flagship vehicle for sending satellites to orbit and beyond.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: The next phase of protests in Israel.

title: 4 Americans Kidnapped in Mexico Border City Were There Seeking Health Care
description: The four came under fire shortly after entering the city of Matamoros from Brownsville, Texas. The F.B.I. is offering a $50,000 reward for their return and the arrest of the kidnappers.

title: Ukraine Claims a Drone Strike on Military Target in Russia
description: The claim was a rare public acknowledgment of a cross-border attack in Russian territory.

title: Ukraine Signals It Will Keep Battling for Bakhmut to Drain Russia
description: Gradual Russian advances and high Ukrainian casualties have fueled talk of a retreat from the eastern city, but Ukrainians say Russian losses are worse, a reason to keep them fighting.
